record.title: AUTHORITY FOR COMMITTEES TO MEET

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON AGRICULTURE, NUTRITION AND FORESTRY
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition and Forestry be authorized to conduct a hearing during the session of the Senate on Wednesday, January 17, 2007 at 9:30 a.m. in 328A, Senate Russell Office Building. The purpose of this committee hearing will be to consider Working Land Conservation: Conservation Security Program and Environmental Quality Incentive Programs.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE, SCIENCE, AND TRANSPORTATION
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Commerce, Science and Transportation be authorized to hold a hearing during the session of the Senate on Wednesday, January 17, 2007, at 10 a.m. in room SR-253 of the Russell Senate Office Building.
The purpose of the hearing is to evaluate the status of implementation of the aviation security recommendations of the 9/11 Commission.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON ENVIRONMENT AND PUBLIC WORKS
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Environment and Public Works be authorized to meet in Executive Session during the session of the Senate on Wednesday, January 17, 2007, at 9:45 a.m. in SD-406.
Rules: Rules of the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Finance be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Wednesday, January 17, 2007, at 10 a.m., in 215 Dirksen Senate Office Building, to organize for the 110th Congress. The Committee will also consider an Original Bill entitled, "The Small Business and Work Opportunity Act of 2007."

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Foreign Relations be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Wednesday, January 17, 2007, at 9:30 a.m. to hold a hearing on Iraq.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on the Judiciary be authorized to meet to conduct a hearing on "Paying Off Generics to Prevent Competition with Brand Name Drugs: Should it Be Prohibited?" on Wednesday, January 17, 2007, at 10:00 a.m. in Dirksen Senate Office Building room 226.
Panel I: Hon. Jon Leibowitz, Commissioner, Federal Trade Commission, Washington, DC.

Panel II: Billy Tauzin, CEO, PhRMA, Washington, DC; Merril Hirsh Partner, Ross, Dixon, and Bell LLP, Washington, DC; Bruce Downey, Chairman and CEO, Barr Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Washington, DC; Michael Wroblewski, Consumers Union, Non-Profit Publisher of Consumer Reports, Yonkers, NY.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Select Committee on Intelligence be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on January 17, 2007, at 2:30 p.m. to hold a closed hearing.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: SUBCOMMITTEE ON READINESS AND MANAGEMENT SUPPORT
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Subcommittee on Readiness and Management Support be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Wednesday, January 17, 2007, at 2:30 p.m., to receive testimony on abusive practices in Department of Defense Contracting for services and inter-agency contracting.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
